org.multiverse.datastructures.collections
Interface BlockingStack<E>

Type Parameters:
E -
All Superinterfaces:
Collection<E>, Iterable<E>
public interface BlockingStack<E>
extends Collection<E>

A BlockingStack interface similar to the BlockingQueue and the BlockingDeque interface.

The java.util.Stack class has no interface and there is no explicit BlockingStack interface (there is a BlockingDeque that can be used as a Stack interface. That is why one was created for the Multiverse project so that different stack implementations can be used without changing (too much) code.

Memory consistency effects: As with other concurrent collections, actions in a thread prior to placing an object into a BlockingStack happen-before actions subsequent to the access or removal of that element from the BlockingStack in another thread.

Method Detail

getRemainingCapacity

int getRemainingCapacity()
Returns the number of additional elements that this stack can ideally (in the absence of memory or resource constraints) accept without blocking, or Integer.MAX_VALUE if there is no intrinsic limit.

Note that you cannot always tell if an attempt to insert an element will succeed by inspecting remainingCapacity because it may be the case that another thread is about to insert or remove an element.

Returns:
the remaining capacity

peek

E peek()
Retrieves, but does not remove the last pushed item of this Stack.

Returns:
the the last pushed item of the stack, or null if the stack is empty.

pop

E pop()
Pops an item of the stack. Waiting if necessary for an item to be placed.

Returns:
the popped item.

poll

E poll()
Retrieves and removes most recently added item.

Returns:
the first element of this stack, or null if this stack is empty

push

void push(E item)
Pushes an item on the stack or fails with an IllegalStateException if the item can't be placed due to capacity restrictions.

Parameters:
item - the item to push.
Throws:
NullPointerException - if item is null.
IllegalStateException - if the element cannot be added at this time stack to capacity restrictions

void put(E item)
         throws InterruptedException

Parameters:

Throws:
NullPointerException - if item is null.
InterruptedException - if the thread was interrupted during the execution

drainTo

int drainTo(Collection<? super E> c)
Removes all available elements from this stack and adds them to the given collection. This operation may be more efficient than repeatedly polling this stack. A failure encountered while attempting to add elements to collection c may result in elements being in neither, either or both collections when the associated exception is thrown. Attempts to drain a stack to itself result in IllegalArgumentException.

Parameters:
c - the collection to transfer elements into
Returns:
the number of elements transferred
Throws:
UnsupportedOperationException - if addition of elements is not supported by the specified collection
ClassCastException - if the class of an element of this stack prevents it from being added to the specified collection
NullPointerException - if the specified collection is null
IllegalArgumentException - if the specified collection is this stack, or some property of an element of this stack prevents it from being added to the specified collection

drainTo

int drainTo(Collection<? super E> c,
            int maxElements)
Removes at most the given number of available elements from this stack and adds them to the given collection. A failure encountered while attempting to add elements to collection c may result in elements being in neither, either or both collections when the associated exception is thrown. Attempts to stack a stack to itself result in IllegalArgumentException.

Parameters:
c - the collection to transfer elements into
maxElements - the maximum number of elements to transfer
Returns:
the number of elements transferred
Throws:
UnsupportedOperationException - if addition of elements is not supported by the specified collection
ClassCastException - if the class of an element of this stack prevents it from being added to the specified collection
NullPointerException - if the specified collection is null
IllegalArgumentException - if the specified collection is this stack, or some property of an element of this stack prevents it from being added to the specified collection
